name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: I stayed there for 100 days. Took advantage of the time there finished school and got a job. I was given no assistance with housing. My property was stolen for me made a report there was nothing done about. People using drugs on the property, fighting, etc. It was like a mini skid row.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: I have never know about these kind of places. Before if it wasn't for the kind  support from the Path of Life social workers. Who have made it easier for people like me to find help when out on the streets. To find that they're are others who work everyday to find solutions. In everyday situation with the friendly hospitality that they have done. With all who have found the kind conversation that the misfortunate have come to have. Thank you again for all you have done for us.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: Path of life ministry is helpful and caring organization . The family shelter helped me and my daughter have a safe place to stay when I was homeless, I got a job through path of life and a referral for housing , it took for me to just follow the rules and regulations and be determined to end being homeless.i am very thankful for path of life services and staff. I now live in a beautiful luxury apartment, ALL THE HONOR AND GLORY TO  GOD FOR BLESSING ME WITH PATH OF LIFE MINISTRY.   SINCERELY, MICHELLE

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: When I reached out for help for a friend in need you didn't bother at all! When people need the help and seek it, you say you will help but when it comes down to it you people turn your back right away. You are all monsters and I hope no one ever, ever treats you the way you treated him. I warn everyone else, please know they will not help you in the dead of night.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text:
This place is a travesty for the homeless. It serves a purpose for some but not others, mainly elderly support and handicapped access. There are many Hippa, OSHA, Fire, Building code and First Aid concerns right off the bat.

If you have asthma or breathing concerns, the cleaning solutions and air conditioner filters and dust are a problem when sleeping.

In 2 weeks I never got the care I was promised and never met with my case worker to assist with my issue.

The security treats you like you are in prison and searches your bags each entry. I find it weird that they know what you have before searching you stuff. Weird.

I got kicked out of there for refusing to let the guard search my bag over and over for brief entries and exits. He seems to get joy demeaning people including seniors and starting fights. I refused to let the guard bully me and got kicked out by management without ever meeting with staff for my goals. A big waste of time and resources.

The nutrition is a problem keeping you tired and unmotivated. Corn Dog, chips and sugar water for example. They also refused to serve me food several times so I went hungry. Bummer. The best part is when outside resources bring food in. Its way better than the breakfast for dinner option. Not good at all. Envision cold eggos waffles, hash brown and Luke warm sausages. One guy got sick and threw up in the dorm. Ridiculous.

There is a lot of fighting and tension for the elderly and things go missing at random. Need I say more?

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: I was a resident once and had a great experience. I was able to work at a warehouse near by and save my money. The staff was caring and hard working. They truly only wanted the best for us and where a great example for me. I was able to take this experience and work it to my favor. I found a permanate transitional home for men due to the fact i no longer wanted to be homeless or around any kind of drug environment. Path of Life was the place that opened my eyes to ways of my mistakes.

review_text:
I wish that I was in position to help put the homeless in a real home. I really don't like what I see. I'm going to pray for everyone on this planet that God will bless each and every one with a permanent home,  job, and  food also clothes.
The main thing is to give it all to the Lord.  Repent and accept the Jesus Christ in their  lives. God is able to do all things in the life of his people. God is a blessing to have in your life.

21/May/21 I'm here once again, being a government target individual you get treated badly. Oh but God sees all what is done unto me and everyone has to answer to the most high father God.
Whatever you don't won't done unto you, you better not do unto others. Still the same thing it's not right. I will continue to pray until God make his move. When here do hope by then people repent and give their life over to Jesus before it's too late.
Continue to do me wrong you will get to there quick.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text:
The following is an update:
It appears that there has been new developments here of late!
The former director has been dismissed and has been replaced by a leader with some ❤️ heart and who is doing a much, much better and more effective job!
Kudos and props to the staff members too for their help and efforts. All your hard work is very much appreciated and does not go unnoticed!
The parking lot and exterior has seen some slight improvement. But speaking candidly it still needs an intense MAKEOVER. POLM is picking up momentem! Please continue your forward and positive progress!

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: This place is a blessing if you're having a hard time in between homes they have a kennel for your pet and clean you have to leave at 8 in the morning and you have to return back at 4 in the afternoon and only one cigarette break at 7 but other than that it's pretty awesome place

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: I dislike the word but due to turn of events not drugs or alcohol I became houseless last year and joined the rejects, the lost, the mentally incapable to fend for themselves @ Path of Life on Hullen St, I lasted there 5 months and used all the tools available like bus passes, food and shelter, plus the direction from staff and help with resume and workshops to put another perspective in such dire situation there I saved my money from temp agencies jobs and bought me a car and slept in it for a couple months after I left this forsaken place; got a permanent job and  living in a nice house going on 6 months, a year and some after I went there broken because I maintained sober and utilized all the local agencies for help.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: Overcrowding, potential for violence among persons is high. Otherwise, a NEEDED resource for the Homeless community!

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: Years and years ago (2005 ish) we stayed for one night due to unfortunate and unexpected events. Years after (2014) we joined the program and lived on the decommissioned Airforce base in Moreno valley. After about 2 months living there and almost ready to get back on track they called us down and said their records tell them we stayed there once before (and we explained yes we did.) And they were so rude and hateful and said this isn't a place just to come and go and kicked us out that night and didn't even give us time to move out. And told us if we ever come back to any of there properties seeking hello they will call the police and have us arrested for trespassing

review_text: This place has the worst atmosphere and they say they dont have funding for anything. Wow..i see them putting poeple back out on the streets back where they started. How is that a solution to tbe homelessness?  This organization hides behind christian organizations as a cover up for the schemes and misleading they do. This my first time in life becoming homeless and there is no real help. Thats why it still exist...sad..we need to hold these organizations accountable ...they still get state and government funding for housing people do they can get and stay rich without helping anyone.

review_text: If your needing help then keep looking .. If your looking for a place to lay your head then your at the right place .. If you dont mind the rude people that show up . The center needs more care more Room and better rules for Living. this is not a substitution for home. Stay busy stay focused and keep asking for other outreach resources. If you are a person that works a nine-to-five then good luck with trying to get head. This might not be a place to Help.  what to remember...  Its 100% free to sleep, Dont bring your belongings nor blanket towel or any linen of the sort no food bags nor Cold foods. Everything is searched as soon as you arrive in the building.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: Rules are very discretionary. Many change based on staff and their mood. It appears that some policies are meant for specific groups and ethnicities. There is a great deal of apathy that exists within the shelter. Very difficult to get a good nights rest. Food is amazing.

review_text: I only gave it one star to make sure my post goes through but the shelter was located at 2530 3rd St Riverside but I did not get an experience that I'd want to even star it. I was sent to this shelter by the community shelter up the street because I had my 3 month son with me. We only stayed over night and the next day, Gloria, I believe she was management, kicked my son and I out because I refused to sign documents that weren't dated correct or filled out. I was told that she was going to fill in infirmation AFTER I signed. Since I wouldn't sign, she threw me and my 3 month old out knowing we didn't have anywhere else to go. Also I didn't notice any staff cooking meals.

This program needs to be shut down PERMANENTLY !

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: It's a blessing that you can feel safe while you sleep instead of the street. They feed you and showers are available. We need more facilities like this. CVRM get big donation from all around. I think we should push for donaters in the city of riverside to curb this homeless problem. That by my observation deals with people that have mental problems,  drugs and finances. Whatever the case. Being lost with out guidance seems the common denominator. So with hope maybe there's willingness. Thanks for the blessings like these facilities to offer hope.

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: The mens home on 5971 Grand Ave. in Riverside, Ca is totally pure hell..I know because i spent 2 years + of my life there. The living arrangements are a joke if you don't mind bed bugs or cockroaches, 2bathrooms for up to 30 guys, makes one wonder where all the cash they make off multiple car washes every week goes??? While the pastors(lol) live in very nice accomendations...There motto should be Do as I say, not as I do...Marcos would know what I mean! This is not a lie from the pit of hell...Joe should know what i mean! They tell you to lie and say your homeless so you can qualify for food stamps and then take them away from you..could keep going on but I've already wasted 10 minutes of my life on them again!

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: When you think of a shelter, you think of a warm safe haven. Instead, there are freezing cold temperatures, getting woken up at 5:15 in the morning and having to fight for a lunch bag to make it until 3:30. Whatever you do, find another alternative other than this shelter. Anyone who has said that their experience with this shelter was great is a liar. A line forms before 3:30 you better be ready to cut in line or theyll turn you down. Dont have a disability because you will definitely be sleeping on a mat in the middle of the floor. If you do not keep up their name and report a grievance they will kick you out!!! beware, this is the devils house in disguise!

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
review_text: Concerning information given to me by a client I am trying to find a shelter for. She was turned away from Path of Life Shelter due to her sexual orientation? Is this a form of discrimination? I believe the state or county should be informed of this information as it could affect their 501C3 funding.
